Desimartini Mahashivratri: An exhaustive playlist of songs to celebrate the festival 
Hindus believe the day marks the convergence of the divine powers of Lord Shiva and Shakti (the female power). This exhaustive playlist will certainly get you into the festive mood. bollywood Updated: Feb 23, 2017 20:13 IST Hindustan Times, New Delhi Mahashivratri is an auspicious festival celebrated to honour Lord Shiva. (Vipin Kumar/ HT Photo) 
Falling on Friday, Mahashivratri is one of the most important Hindu festivals of the year. According to Hindu mythology, devotees celebrate the ‘Chaturdashi’ of ‘Phagun’, the Hindu lunar month, as the wedding day of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati. Hindus believe the day marks the convergence of the divine powers of Lord Shiva and Shakti (the female power). Some people also celebrate the day as Shiva’s birthday. 
Here’s an exhaustive playlist of songs that will certainly get you into the festive mood: 
Jai Jai Shiv Shankar Film: Aap Ki Kasam (1974) Singer: Kishore Kumar 
Film: Satyam Shivam Sundaram (1978) Singer: Lata Mangeshkar
